subject: p16751749
History: COPD, bilateral chest tubes, assess for pneumothorax.
Findings: There is no pneumothorax or pleural effusion. Cardiac size is normal. Patient has severe emphysema. Bilateral chest tubes are in unchanged position. Multifocal consolidations in the upper lobe and lower lobe bilaterally, worse in the left upper lobe and right lower lobe have increased in the right lower lobe, consistent with multifocal pneumonia and or hemorrage. Severe subcutaneous emphysema in bilateral chest wall is unchanged. ET tube is in standard position. NG tube tip is in the stomach. There are no other changes from eight hours before.
